required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase IIIb Study to Compare Entecavir Plus Tenofovir vs. Adefovir Added to Continuing Lamivudine Therapy in Adult Patients With Lamivudine-Resistant Hepatitis B Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study of the Antiviral Efficacy and Safety of Entecavir Plus Tenofovir Versus Adefovir Added to Continuing Lamivudine in Adults With Lamivudine- Resistant Chronic Hepatitis B Virus Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to find out whether a combination of entecavir (ETV) plus tenofovir (TNF) works better against Hepatitis B virus than adefovir (ADV) added to continuing lamivudine (LVD) therapy in patients whose Hepatitis B virus (HBV) is resistant against lamivudine. The safety of this treatment will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved an Hepatitis B Virus DNA (HBV DNA) Level < 50 IU/mL at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HBV Test for use with the High Pure System (HPS) assay, by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR); HBV DNA < 50 IU/mL = approximately 300 copies/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved an HBV DNA Level <50 IU/mL at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: by PCR, using the Roche COBAS®TaqMan - HPS assay; HBV DNA < 50 IU/mL = approximately 300 copies/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Discontinuations Due to AEs or Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through end of treatment (Week 100 +/- 5 days)
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, and/or is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved HBV DNA < the Lower Limit of Detection (LLD) at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: by PCR, using the Roche for the Roche COBAS® TaqMan - HPS assay. LLD = 4.8 IU/mL (approximately 28 copies/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: HBV DNA Values at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with HBV DNA <LLD (4.8); LLD to <50; 50 to <172; 172 to <1,720; 1,720 to <17,200; and ≥17,200 IU/mL (<LLD (28); 28 to <300; 300 to <1,000; 1,000 to <10,000; 10,000 to <100,000; and ≥100,000 copies/mL by PCR, using the Roche COBAS®TaqMan - HPS assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean log10 Reduction From Baseline in HBV DNA at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: by PCR, using the Roche COBAS®TaqMan - HPS assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) > 1 x Upper Limit of Normal (ULN) at Baseline Who Achieved ALT Normalization (≤ 1 x ULN) at Weeks 48 and 96
Number of Participants Who Were Hepatitis B E-antigen (HBeAg)-Positive at Baseline With Loss of HBeAg at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBeAg is a hepatitis B viral protein. It is an indicator of active viral replication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were HBeAg-positive at Baseline With HBe Seroconversion at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBe seroconversion = HBeAg loss and presence of hepatitis B e-antibody (HBeAb)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hepatitis-B-Virus Surface Antigen of the (HBsAg) Loss at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) = a part of the hepatitis B virus that, when in the blood, is an early marker of infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HBs Seroconversion (HBsAg Loss and Presence of HBsAb) at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) = a part of the hepatitis B virus that, when in the blood, is an early marker of infection. HBsAb = HBsAg antibodies. HBs Seroconversion = HBsAg loss and presence of HBseAb

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Genotypic Resistance Based on Analysis of Samples From Participants With HBV DNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at Weeks 48 and 96

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral Entecavir 1 mg + Tenofovir 300 mg, once daily, 100 weeks
Tablets, Oral, Adefovir 10 mg + Lamivudine, 100 mg, once daily, 100 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic HBV infection
- History of lamivudine (LVD) treatment, and lamivudine resistance (LVDr), receiving LVD at screening visit
- Compensated liver function
- HBV DNA ≥ 172,000 IU/mL
- Hepatitis B e-antigen (HBeAg)-positive or HBeAg-negative
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of decompensated cirrhosis
- Coinfection with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis C virus (HCV), or hepatitis D virus (HDV)
- Recent history of pancreatitis
- Serum alpha fetoprotein > 100 ng/mL
- Except lamivudine, any prior therapy with nucleoside or nucleotide analogue antiviral agents with activity against hepatitis B

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 84 subjects were to be treated with entecavir (ETV) plus tenofovir (TNF) or adefovir (ADV) added to continuing lamivudine (LVD).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 4 subjects enrolled, 2 were not randomized (reasons: “Subject no longer meets study criteria” and “Other”). Both subjects randomized were treated as well.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Following review of business priorities, BMS decided to terminate this study at an early stage. This was a strategic decision, not based on clinical or safety concerns. Due to limited data, no conclusions on safety and efficacy can be made.
